Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Tommy?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: I was just passing through. Figured why not have a belt with the old man.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Yeah, she's hanging in there.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Well, you always did take good care of her. Paddy Conlon. Man of priorities.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: She did. But that's not for me anymore, Tommy.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: What? You change brands?

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: C'mon, let's go inside.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: I like what you've done with the place.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: There's not much of a woman's touch around here.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Yeah? Must be hard to find a girl who can take a punch nowadays.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Here you go.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Coffee? You haven't seen a guy in 14 years and you're not gonna have a drink with him?

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: I told you, I'm off it. I'm coming up on a thousand days.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: C'mon, just one drink.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: So you found God, huh? That's awesome. Mom kept calling for him, but he wasn't around. I guess Jesus was down at the mill forgiving all the drunks. Who knew?

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: I know.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Oh, you know? What do you know? Do you know it wasn't enough just to drive west to get away from you? When we hit the water we drove north, too.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: When I got sober I hired a man to find you.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Is that one of the 12 steps? Or does a guy like you get 24?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Did your guy tell you what you needed to know?

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Just that your mother died in Tacoma. And you were in the Marines. That was all. That was enough.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: That's too bad. You could've gotten some good details.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: I'm sorry, Tommy.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: It's good to know you're sorry, Pop. Goes a long way.

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: What's going on here?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Well, I'm not sure, but I think Daddy is now a princess.

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: Em, you want to open your presents?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: It's her birthday.

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: I know, but that's why you call it a budget. You set it, and you don't budge.

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: Hey babe, I'm late. Mom's saying goodbye to the girls. She's gotta get on the road. They've been fed. They just need a bath.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I'm on it.

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: Can you get them down at a reasonable time tonight? They're exhausted.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Where's the rest of that skirt?

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: Babe.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Listen, if any guys give you a hassle in that joint tonight you give me a call, okay?

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: Yeah. Just like you gave me a call when those Temple frat boys decided to smash up your face.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I told you, most nights I sit on the stool and grade papers, but every now and then I need some action.

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: Alright, well wait up for me tonight. I'll see what I can do about that.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Promises, promises.

Dialogue: Fitzy still own this?

Speaker: fenroy
Dialogue: Don't know no Fitzy. Colt Boyd owns this gym.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: How's it work here?

Speaker: fenroy
Dialogue: Thirty five a month with locker. We're open at 7, lights out at 11. You wanna join?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: fenroy
Dialogue: Put your name and contact info on the card.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Whoa whoa whoa! There's a lesson in this too, OK? Listen up. So we have a body at rest, and you have the bat which needs--

Speaker: tito
Dialogue: Acceleration.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Acceleration, right. If you have enough acceleration, you have might have a chance to break the body at rest. OK. Go ahead.

Speaker: nash
Dialogue: Force equals mass times acceleration. We got it.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Alright. The third law--

Speaker: stephon
Dialogue: How many laws this dude got?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: The dude? The dude has three. Newton the dude says that for every action, there's an equal and opposite reaction.

Speaker: kc
Dialogue: Mr. C, I put it away.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Alright, before you go, I have your tests from last week.

Speaker: mad dog
Dialogue: Where do you find these girls?

Speaker: colt boyd
Dialogue: We got a tournament coming up. You gonna kill every guy in the `Burgh?  Fenroy. Get me some ice. And call that Puerto Rican kid, the one that fights outa the Bottoms. If he's here in 20 minutes, he gets 200 bucks.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Yo, I'll fight him.

Speaker: colt boyd
Dialogue: Do me a favor guy, go back to your bag. We don't need anybody else getting hurt. G'head. Take a walk.

Speaker: mad dog
Dialogue: Yo Rock, what happened? You leave Mick and Paulie at home today?

Speaker: fenroy
Dialogue: His phone's disconnected.

Speaker: colt boyd
Dialogue: Then go through the list. Get me Joe Bones.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: All I'm saying is if you need somebody to help you, I'm happy to keep your boy warm for you.

Speaker: colt boyd
Dialogue: You ever fought before?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: colt boyd
Dialogue: This guy sign a waiver?

Speaker: fenroy
Dialogue: All good.

Speaker: colt boyd
Dialogue: What's your name?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Tommy.

Speaker: colt boyd
Dialogue: You get tuned up in here, it's on you, Tommy.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Sure, no problem.

Speaker: colt boyd
Dialogue: Come on in.

Speaker: mad dog
Dialogue: Gonna be a hero? Alright.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: You owe me two hundred bucks.

Speaker: dan taylor
Dialogue: This is the new appraisal figure, and this is how it effects the monthly. As you can see, that puts you upside down on your mortgage. That's the problem. It's the country that did the assessment, not the bank. So, the numbers are what they are, Mr. Conlon.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Brendan.

Speaker: dan taylor
Dialogue: The numbers are what they are, Brendan. I mean, you're a Math teacher, you can appreciate that.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I teach Physics.

Speaker: dan taylor
Dialogue: Physics. OK. But the bank has got to go by the new appraisal figures. According to these figures, you're upside down on your mortgage--

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: You said that three times already. I get that. But I'm asking you if there's something else you can do. Not the bank, you. Can you shift things around, restructure--

Speaker: dan taylor
Dialogue: Well, you've already refinanced twice.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Because you advised us to do that.

Speaker: dan taylor
Dialogue: I presented you with that option. It was your choice.  I'm also showing you netted a substantial payout with the refi.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: We had that conversation. I was paying medical bills. Is that in your file?

Speaker: dan taylor
Dialogue: Oh, right. Sorry. Your daughter's...kidney?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Heart.

Speaker: dan taylor
Dialogue: Heart, right.  Lot of stories.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: So my option is I've got no options? You're not even gonna try to help me?

Speaker: dan taylor
Dialogue: I am trying, Brendan. Look, I can get you 90 days to get even--

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: 90 days is not enough. My wife and I have three jobs between us and that doesn't cut it. So, what do you suggest?

Speaker: dan taylor
Dialogue: Let me ask you a question: have you considered bankruptcy? It's a viable option. There's no shame in it these days.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: That's not how I do things.

Speaker: dan taylor
Dialogue: Well, then you're looking at foreclosure.

Speaker: colt boyd
Dialogue: How you doin,' sir? I'm looking for Tommy Riordan.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: colt boyd
Dialogue: Tommy Riordan? My name's Colt Boyd.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: What business you got with Tommy?

Speaker: colt boyd
Dialogue: None yet. That's why I'm here. I manage fighters.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Conlon. Name's Conlon. And anything you want to know about Tommy, you gotta ask him yourself.

Speaker: colt boyd
Dialogue: I'm just looking for some general information here.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Like I said, anything you want to know about Tommy, you gotta ask him yourself.

Speaker: colt boyd
Dialogue: Look, I don't mean to interrupt your night. He put this address down when he signed up at the gym.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: He doesn't live here.

Dialogue: It's time for our next contest! Introducing first, fighting out of the red corner, from Ripley, West Virginia, please welcome Mike "The Mutilator" Moore!

Speaker: referee
Dialogue: Fighters to the center! I want you to obey my commands at all times. If you have no questions, touch gloves, back up, and wait for my signal. Come out fighting!

Dialogue: Nice fight. Two more wins and you take home the bacon.

Dialogue: Hey babe. How was work?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I'm not bouncing at a club.

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: What do you mean you're not bouncing?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I went in to apply. They were only paying nine bucks an hour. Then I saw a sign for this other thing.

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: I thought we agreed that we weren't going to raise our children in a family where their father gets beat up for a living.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: We're not giving up the house. This is our home. We're not going BACKWARDS

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: We'll figure it out. But this is what we're not going back to.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: You wanted to talk?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Yeah.  I'm gonna start fighting.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: That right?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Don't play babe in the woods with me. I know that guy from the gym came to see you.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Colt Boyd? I didn't tell him anything, Tommy.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: We wouldn't be sitting here now if you did.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: What about Colt Boyd?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: What about him? I told him I don't train with people I don't know.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Ah, the devil you know.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Excuse me?

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: The devil you know is better than the devil you don't.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: I just told you, this doesn't mean anything. You get that through your skull right now or I'm walking.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Alright. Alright. But you get something through your skull, too. You called me. So don't go threatening to walk every five minutes. And since this is about training, you dump whatever it is you need to dump as far as those pills are concerned. I don't want to see `em.

Dialogue: My brother said he was at the strip club and saw Mr. C fighting MMA---

Dialogue: What's MMA?

Speaker: stephon
Dialogue: Mixed Martial Arts. Like, different styles of fighting.

Speaker: kc
Dialogue: Your brother's a liar.

Dialogue: Take your seats.

Speaker: tito
Dialogue: Yo, Mr. C. My brother was at the titty bar last night and said you was choking brothers out. What's up? Is it true?

Speaker: stephon
Dialogue: Yeah, Mr. C. I mean, did you really work on some fools or something?

Speaker: kc
Dialogue: You have to tell us.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: C'mon, it's not as bad as it looks.

Speaker: joe zito
Dialogue: Are you being literal or figurative? Because literally it looks bad. And figuratively it looks even worse. The superintendent's coming by in a few minutes. So gimme a little help here, Brendan. Can you explain to me what the hell you were doing?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I need the money, Joe.

Speaker: joe zito
Dialogue: Yeah, but we can't have this. This isn't moonlighting at Applebee's for Christ's sake.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Actually, I used to be one of those animals.

Speaker: joe zito
Dialogue: Yeah, I guess you did.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Look, I'm sorry, Joe. It's just--

Speaker: joe zito
Dialogue: Listen, the school district's not going to tolerate school teachers cockfighting in strip clubs.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: It was the parking lot of a strip club.

Speaker: joe zito
Dialogue: Wherever it was, you can't be doing it, alright? I mean this is a serious--shit, he's here.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: What are we gonna do?

Speaker: joe zito
Dialogue: You say yes, sir. And you say no, sir. And you say it'll never happen again, sir. And then we just pray to God he's in a good mood.

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: How'd it go?

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: They're gonna review your case at the end of the semester, but until then you're suspended without pay. Joe gave me the number of his attorney.

Dialogue: How the hell are we gonna pay for an attorney?

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: He talked to me for free. As a favor to Joe.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: That was nice.

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: He said there's no precedent for this. You'll be back by next semester.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Next semester?

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: You're gonna put yourself through this over and over, for five hundred bucks a pop?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Some of them pay a little more than that.  I would have had to bounce for a month to make what I made in two hours last night.

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: What are we gonna tell the girls?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: It'll be fine. I'll just leave the house as usual, except now I'll be going to the gym.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Oh the duck says quack and the cow says moo, and the old red rooster says cock-a-doodle-doo. Cock-a- doodle-doo.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Yeah, I'll tell ya something. You can take that thing back to where you found it. And you can leave the coffee in the pot. I can pour that myself. I can wake myself up, too.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: OK. Hurt my knees coming up and down those stairs anyway.

Dialogue: What's that?

Dialogue: Who's "Mad Dog" Grimes?

Dialogue: Wait, rewind that.

Dialogue: AV, I need to see the tape!

Dialogue: What tape?

Speaker: bradford
Dialogue: The tape.

Speaker: bradford
Dialogue: Freeze.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Let the music sink in to you. This is Beethoven. Breathe. Breathe.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Liking the place, Frank.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Thank you, brother.  You see this beast? Marco Santos? I'm training him for Sparta.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Amazing, man.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Come on back.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: You look good, brother. How're the girls?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Good. Good. I had another little one. Rosie.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I know. Johnny C. told me she was in the hospital for a bit. I was gonna call, but then time went by. I don't know. I'm a piece of shit. I should have called.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: It's alright.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: No, Brendan. I'm sorry.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: It's all good. She's good now.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: It's great to see you, man. So everything's going good?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Yeah. Well, I've got a little problem. The guys at the bank want to take my house away. That's kind of why I came to see you, actually.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I've got most of my dough tied up in this joint, but how much do you need?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I didn't come here for a loan, Frank.  I was hoping you'd train me.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Train you for what?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I want to get back in the cage.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: You're serious?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I just won an event the other night.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Ah, you won an event.  That's what this is. Let me guess, it was in a parking lot. DJ from the local radio station. Couple of ring card girls you wouldn't bang on a dare. Am I right?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Ish.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Ish. Brendan. I love you. I do. But why would I train you? When you were in shape and on the right side of 30 you were barely a .500 fighter. You never listened to me. You never listened to anyone. These guys are animals. I mean, you're a teacher, right? What're you gonna do? You're gonna come down here for a couple days a week after detention? You're gonna skip out of the girl's volleyball game early?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I've got loads of time. Time's not an issue. The parking lot thing kinda got me suspended. I need to keep working the smokers.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Tess know about this?  Yeah? `Cause the last time you fought, I got read the riot act sitting in a hospital waiting room. You remember that?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: No. I was unconscious.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: She's not gonna come down here with the two puppies, screaming at Frank?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: It's not gonna happen. Come on. Whattya say, Frank?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: What do I say? What am I gonna say to you? No? I mean, all my time is wrapped up with Marco. You come down, I'll throw you in the rotation, you spar with these guys, no problem. But I can't promise you much more than that, Brendan.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: That's all I need.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Let me know when you're coming down.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Well, I'm just gonna go get my stuff from the car.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Now?

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Hey, Brendan. It's me, Pop.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: What're you doing here?

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: I have some news for you.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Something wrong with your hands?

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Yeah, I forgot--

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Phone or mail, Pop. Non negotiable.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Hey Brendan, have you ever seen my hands so steady? Have you?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I'm going inside.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: I've got a thousand days. A thousand days sober today.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Well, that's great, Pop. But it doesn't change anything.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: What do you mean it doesn't change anything? Have a heart, Brendan.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: You listen to me. You take your have-a-heart bullshit and you run it down the road. Run it out on someone who doesn't know you like I do.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: C'mon, Brendan. I thought maybe we could break bread. Open some lines of communication.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: You got two lines of communication, the telephone and the post office. Just because you decide it's a special day, it doesn't make it one for me. I got a wife and kids inside and they're waiting for me, so I don't have time for whatever this is.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: I know you got a wife and kids in there. I got a grand-daughter I haven't seen in three years and another I haven't even ever met.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Why is that, Pop? Why is that? Do you remember having anything to do with that?

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Tommy's back.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Tommy's in Pittsburgh?

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: He came to see me.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: He came to see you?

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: He's over at the house. We're doing a little training at Fitzy's. Remember Fitzy's? It ain't Fitzy's anymore.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: You and Tommy are training together?

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Riordan. He's using your mother's maiden name now.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I know what her name is.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: I thought you'd want to know he's back. That's why I drove all the way over here.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I thought you came to break bread over a thousand days?

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: That too.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Did he say if he wants to see me?

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: He doesn't say much. He's just not that happy kid he was.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Wow, look at you. Mister inside man.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: You came to gloat.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: I did not come to gloat. I came to get my son back.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Well, there you go. You got your son back.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: I'm talking about you, Bren--

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: You got your son back.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Ah, Brendan. I was a drunk. I mean, you know. I'm sorry.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Forget it. You were always a front runner. You never had any interest in underdogs. But I was your son.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: You are my son.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Am I?

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Yeah, you are. I'm just asking you to find just a little space in your heart to forgive me.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Yeah. Alright. I forgive you. But I do not trust you. Tell Tommy this is where I am if he wants to see me.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Alright. But they're not different things. You've gotta trust to FORGIVE--

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Goodnight, Pop.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: My God, is that Emily? Boy, she's grown, Brendan. Is that Rosie?

Speaker: rosie
Dialogue: Daddy, who is that?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Just some nice old man.

Dialogue: Huge news breaking here at ESPN. Koba is coming to America and will fight at Sparta. Universally considered to be the greatest pound for pound fighter that ever lived, the mighty, mythical Russian has never fought on U.S. soil in his legendary career...

Speaker: colt boyd
Dialogue: Tommy? Got some news for ya. I got you into Sparta. Took some doing, but I made it happen..  Thank you and 10 percent is customary.

Speaker: pilar
Dialogue: Bueno?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Pilar. It's Tommy.

Speaker: pilar
Dialogue: Tommy! Dios mio! I can't believe it! How are you?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Good good. How you doin'?

Speaker: pilar
Dialogue: OK. You know me, Tommy.  I was getting really worried about you.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: How're things? Kids are good?

Speaker: pilar
Dialogue: They're good. Maria's getting so big. She looks more like Manny every day.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: How's little man?

Speaker: pilar
Dialogue: He's good. He's a good kid, Tommy. Takes care of his sister. He's a great kid. Everyone's good.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: You know, Pilar, I haven't forgotten for one minute what I promised you. What I promised Manny. I've got an opportunity coming up to help you guys out. To take care of you guys.

Speaker: pilar
Dialogue: Whatever you can do, Tommy. I know Manny would really appreciate it. You worry too much. It's OK. We're hanging in there.

Dialogue: No he did not tap you! Physics teacher! That's the best in the world there, son.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: You gonna be OK? Wanna grab a bite?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Nah. I'm gonna head home. I gotta call the boys and break the news. I'll call you tomorrow.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Coach! Hey, I know this isn't a great time. And it's too bad about Marco. But what about me?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: You talking about Sparta? Brendan, please. You got a better chance of starting a boy band. I'll talk to you tomorrow.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: It's a grand prix tournament. Which means anything can happen. You know that as well as I do.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: That's what I'm afraid of.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Frank, I need this. You're real tight with those guys. You call them, they'll listen to you.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: You realize what you're asking me to do here, Brendan? We go down to AC and you get tapped out in five seconds, how does that benefit either one of us?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: That's not gonna happen.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Not gonna happen. Wish I had a nickel for every time I heard that.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: It's not gonna happen.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I'll make a call.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I love my coach!

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: Really? So that's your decision? You decided? `Cause I really enjoyed that conversation we just had about making that decision together.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: It's a lot of money, Tess.

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: I don't give a shit about the money, Brendan. I told you that. We're gonna end up cashing in your life insurance policy before we pick up that prize money.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: You don't think I can do it.

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: I think you can get killed.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I'm not gonna get killed.

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: Fine, you're not going to get killed. But can you promise me you're not going to get hurt? You're not gonna end up in the hospital? You're not gonna end up paralyzed? We'll have no prize money. No house. Payments for HOSPITAL BILLS--

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Tess, I can promise you this: if I don't try, they're gonna take the house. How's that for a promise?

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: I'm not gonna watch you fight again. I'm not.  I'm gonna get the girls breakfast.

Dialogue: J.J., you've made a fortune with your hedge funds, yet you turned your back on Wall Street and dedicated your life to making Sparta happen. Tell us, why is this tournament so important to you?

Speaker: sheridan
Dialogue: Thank you, J.J. And here's something fans never thought they'd see: Koba is here! The legend arriving to fight on U.S. soil for the very first time...

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Hey. Where'd you go? You can't leave me like that. They wanna talk to you, not me.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Tommy!

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: I'm takin' a walk.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Been looking all over for you. How's it going?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: It's going.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I was thinking maybe we could grab a coffee.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: I don't drink coffee. Whattya want?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: You don't want to go sit down somewhere?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: I'm good right here.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Shit, Tommy. How was I supposed to know I was never gonna see you guys again?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: You were briefed. You had the information. You chose the old man and the girl.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: She wasn't some girl. I married her. She's my wife.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Don't know `em.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I know you don't know them. Of course you don't know them.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Why am I looking at pictures of people I don't know?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Because that's my family.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: And who are you exactly?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I'm your brother, man.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: You were in the Corps?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: I said I didn't know you were in the Corps.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I wasn't in the Corps.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Then you ain't no brother to me. My brother was in the Corps.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Jesus, Tommy. I was a 16 year old kid. What the hell did I know?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: I don't know what you know. Why don't you go ask your girlfriend about it?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: She's my wife, Tommy. So that's it? I stay with Tess and I never get to see you guys again? Not a single phone call? Nothing?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Shit. He's just some old vet I train with. He means nothing to me. From what I hear he means nothing to you, either, so you got balls talking about forgiveness.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: That's got nothing to do with forgiveness. I've got a family to protect. Everything I do is for them.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: You forgave us?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: I'm not surprised you made the tournament, Brendan. You got some stones.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I fell in love, Tommy. What the hell was I supposed to do?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: You were supposed to stick to the plan. You were supposed to come with us. Mom needed you. I needed you. You were my big brother and you bailed on me.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: You're not the only one who suffered, Tommy. I didn't even know she was sick. I never even got the chance to say goodbye to my own mother. You had no right to keep that from me! That was not your decision to make!

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: You know what? You walk around with your pictures in your wallet and you're all, I forgive you, I forgive Pop. I forgive everyone. But you know what? You're full of shit.

Speaker: joe zito
Dialogue: You realize you're supposed to seek my wise counsel when school's actually in session, right?

Speaker: stephon
Dialogue: We want to use the auditorium this weekend to watch Mr. C in Sparta.

Speaker: tito
Dialogue: What do you say?

Speaker: joe zito
Dialogue: Let me get this straight. You want to use the auditorium to watch a suspended teacher engage in the activity he was suspended for? Am I hearing this correctly?  I gotta talk to your parents. You guys might need to be in summer school after all.

Speaker: nash
Dialogue: But everyone wants to see it.

Speaker: kc
Dialogue: The gym's the only place that's big enough.

Speaker: joe zito
Dialogue: It's never gonna happen.

Speaker: stephon
Dialogue: What if we get a petition?

Speaker: tito
Dialogue: Yeah. We'll get the whole school to sign it.

Speaker: nash
Dialogue: The power of democracy!

Speaker: joe zito
Dialogue: Look, I appreciate that you guys love your teacher. I really do. But there is nothing I can do for you.

Speaker: callen
Dialogue: Welcome, I'm Bryan Callen along with best-selling fight author Sam Sheridan. Sam, when J.J. Riley conceived Sparta he wanted to create, quite simply, the biggest Mixed Martial Arts spectacle in history.

Speaker: sheridan
Dialogue: Five million dollars, Bryan. Five million dollars. J.J. Riley put his money where his mouth is and put up the biggest purse this sport has ever seen.

Speaker: callen
Dialogue: It's unprecedented, Sam. As is the hoopla surrounding Tommy Riordan, the war hero who has become an overnight sensation...

Speaker: official
Dialogue: Five minutes, Paddy.

Speaker: callen
Dialogue: Sam. He ripped the door off a tank!

Speaker: josh rosenthal
Dialogue: Gentlemen, you've been given your instructions. I expect a clean fight. Obey my commands at all times. Defend yourselves at all times. Touch gloves, go back, let's do this.

Speaker: official
Dialogue: Show time.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: You can do this.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I can do this.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Then let's go do this.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Go get `em, son.

Speaker: callen
Dialogue: Classical music is about as fitting to this setting as Brendan Conlon is to this tournament. In fact, let me show you something.

Speaker: sheridan
Dialogue: C'mon, give the guy a break. At least we've seen him fight before. He was in the UFC. We remember him.

Speaker: callen
Dialogue: I remember him, too. I remember him being very unmemorable.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: You asked for it.

Speaker: josh rosenthal
Dialogue: Alright, gentleman, you've been given your instructions, I expect a clean fight. Obey my commands at all times. Defend yourselves at all times. Touch gloves, go back, let's do this.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Have some fun, baby.

Speaker: zito
Dialogue: Move! You gotta move!

Speaker: zito
Dialogue: C'mon, Brendan, get outta there!

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Get out of there! Get out of there!

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Beautiful! Beautiful! He doesn't know what hit him!

Speaker: sheridan
Dialogue: It just did, Bryan.

Speaker: zito
Dialogue: He tapped him out! He tapped him out! He did it! He did it! He did it!

Speaker: callen
Dialogue: Very technical finish, but come on, that's a fluke.

Speaker: sheridan
Dialogue: I hope you got a receipt for your goldfish.

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: Yes!

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: You can do it, Brendan.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Take him down!

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: That's it, Brendan!

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Way to go, Brendan!

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I'd doing this!

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: OK, son.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I'm doing it!

Speaker: josh rosenthal
Dialogue: Gentlemen, you ready? You ready? Let's go to war!

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Can't sleep, huh?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: How about deserting my unit? Is that really something, too? Yeah. I was on my way outta country when I came across those guys. What was I supposed to do, let `em drown?

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: No.  What'd you do?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: What'd I do? I took off.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: That's why you go by Riordan. That's why the press can't find your service records.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: That is none of your business.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: Come on, kiddo. I've been there. I've done it. I've seen it. You can trust me. I'll understand.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Spare me the compassionate father routine, Pop. The suit don't fit.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: I'm really trying here, Tommy.

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: You're trying? Now? Where were you when it mattered? I needed this guy back when I was a kid. I don't need you now. It's too late now. Everything's already happened. You and Brendan don't seem to understand that. Let me explain something to you: the only thing I have in common with Brendan Conlon is that we have absolutely no use for you.

Speaker: paddy
Dialogue: God pity `em! All shall perish except me! You bastards! Stop the ship, you bastards!

Speaker: marines
Dialogue: From the halls of Montezuma to the shores of Tripoli, we will fight our country's battles in the air, on land, and sea...

Speaker: sheridan
Dialogue: It sounds like VJ Day in Times Square, Bryan. I've never seen anything like it!

Speaker: josh rosenthal
Dialogue: Alright gentlemen, you've been given your instructions. I expect a clean fight. Obey my commands at all times. Defend yourselves at all times. Touch gloves, go back, let's do this.

Dialogue: It's not gonna happen again.

Speaker: josh rosenthal
Dialogue: Gentlemen, you ready? You ready? Let's go to war!

Speaker: colt boyd
Dialogue: Stop it! Stop the fight!

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: You've got a visitor. Second row, 10 o'clock.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I want you to look right at him when he comes in here. Don't take your eyes off him.

Speaker: josh rosenthal
Dialogue: Alright, gentlemen, you've been given your instructions. I expect a clean fight.

Speaker: josh rosenthal
Dialogue: Gentlemen, you ready? You ready? Let's go to war!

Speaker: josh rosenthal
Dialogue: Let's go to war!

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Sit down. Breathe.  Look at me! Look at me! Why are we here, Brendan? Why are we here? Are we here to win this fight? You tell me, `cause if we're not, I'll throw in the towel right now. We'll get Tess and we will go home. You don't knock him out, you lose the fight. Understand me? You don't knock him out, you don't have a home.

Speaker: josh rosenthal
Dialogue: Let's go to war!

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Crank it! Crank it!

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: What are you gonna do?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I'm gonna fight him.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: One more time.

Speaker: josh rosenthal
Dialogue: Gentlemen, this is the final. Five rounds. I expect a clean fight. Obey my commands at all times. Defend yourselves at all times. Touch gloves, go back, let's do this.

Dialogue: Where's Pop?

Speaker: josh rosenthal
Dialogue: Gentlemen, are you ready? Are you ready? Let's go to war!

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: What was that!

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: C'mon, Josh!

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Angle out, hit, and move.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Good. Breathe. Relax. He's not your brother, right? He's just a guy who's in the way.

Dialogue: Switch! Switch!

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Tap, Tommy!

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I popped his shoulder.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Relax, breathe.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I heard it tear.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: You popped his shoulder? Good. I want you to pop his other shoulder.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Josh!

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Hey! Hey! No Josh! Look at me! You got two rounds left! You need both rounds! Go in there, kick him in the head, take him down, and finish him!

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Tommy! What are you doing?

Speaker: tommy
Dialogue: Shut up! C'mon.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: What are you that crazy?

Speaker: josh rosenthal
Dialogue: Let's go to war!

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: What are you doing? It's over!

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Finish him! You finish him!

Dialogue: Break! Break!
